comments.body: maybe with other blocks
Thank you so much for putting that out there, because I love secret bases.

I had this idea independently a few days ago, and I’m on board! Right now, in order to make a secret library entrance, I have to make a huge mechanism involving comparators, a book, a lectern, and a lot of redstone. I really like the idea of being able to click on a bookshelf (like I’m pulling a specific book) and opening a secret entrance like in Scooby-Doo!
Same here. I had the idea that they would have a similar functionality as a button i.e., putting out a temporary pulse.
Also I think that if the suction block was inverted, it should spit out all of its contents.

I think the dispenser has seen some things...

 

 

(BTW I voted I think this would be cool)

Does it pick up the things? Because if it does, it shouldn’t suck in players. 

My idea: It picks up items, but only attracts mobs and players.
it looks weird but might be good
Can you obtain this item?

1. please if you block it do not because when you block it. it teleport so please don,t block it. 

2. ahhhh no the suction block it is taking me
guys if u cut the top 6 parts it will look like a dropper so it has todo smth with the dropper

Do you have any mod for it?
For 1.21.6 java fabric?
lost face myth like
no, just vote
Additional functionality could include a feature where they conduct redstone when closed. They are not a repeater. They would output the signal inputted, minus one.
Another idea would be for "Bluestone" to cross over or under Redstone when placed so they won't interact.
There would also be a setting in gameplay to swap redstone and bluestone. Bluestone could be crafted in survival by placing redstone in crafting thing.

I like this idea as this doesn't require the need to rework the entirety of the current redstone system. 

Edit: I also like this idea because finally create mixed circuits that include both Java bluestone and Bedrock redstone and because both editions will finally be equal in the field of redstone.
is a great idea

Bluestone could also be combined with the copper plating quasi connectivity mechanic. https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/20518737741837-Copper-plating-on-Redstone-components-enables-directional-QuasiConnectivity
you can already change a rail corner's direction with a redstone signal
yea, we need better rails. this is a small part of it.

As a model railroader I would love to be able to build railroads in minecraft where tracks can intersect, cross over one another etc. I would love to be able to use switch tracks to move minecarts from one set of tracks to another. I envision something like a minecraft lever (or fancier red-stone circuit) next to the switch track to make the track change.
This is a good idea because you can have three places like a mine village and base and then have a Minecart transport it
It would make it easier to change direction not using redstone

Perhaps this could be accomplished with but he rotator block idea. It's also on here. It's a block that upon getting activated by redstone will rotate whatever block its rotating side is connected to by 90 degrees.
Par contre t'aurais pus traduire en anglais !

Je ne penses pas forcément que ce soit dans l'esprit de minecraft, même si l'idée semble pas mal, je verrais ça plus vers les mods que dans la version officiel. les nombres de "trolls" et de vol en multi serait très grand et deviendrais vite horrible a jouer

Désolé mais pas de soutien pour ma part
Creo que zi :v
The sculk sensor just got added in 20w49a, and it can be waterlogged, so I think this suggestion can be marked as done now.
That would be epic, maybe there could also be a chain repeater.

I came to post this idea because I was just trying to hang some redstone lamps from chains without a dang power source like a lever sticking off the side of it. Would be good not just for compacting redstone builds but even for simple applications.
I think it should only be redstone dust. It should also be crafted with eight redstone dust and a slime ball. Not incredibly useful though, now that I think of it.
make it so that you can stick honeycomb to redstone and it will stick to the walls
Would be interesting to see the redstone community making even more compact contraptions with something like this!

I was thinking of this as well, but your recipe sounds too expensive. What I would suggest is:

[_][X][_]

[X][Y][X]

[_][X][_]

The symbols represent:

[_] = blank space

[X] = redstone dust

[Y] = iron ingot

 

The reason I believe this is what it should be is because all it's doing is acting as a couple of wires. To separate the one bit of redstone dust from another, wrapping one of the redstone wires with an iron ingot should be just enough to "realistically" prevent the redstone signals from interfering with each other.

Updated the crafting recipe to the one that Syprene commented. I think it’s much better now imo. It would definitely be much more appealing to those in survival who want more of a variety to experiment with Redstone, and don’t have to use many expensive materials. Thx for the suggestion :D

I was also thinking about it but implementing the new items from update 1.17. So, you could replace iron with copper or include it in the recipe mentioned and this new redstone component would be a block capable of crossing circuits in 3 dimensions.

When I was little and rails were just new to MCPE, I tried connecting rails down from a slope. It wouldn't work and I was sad. I tried launching a minecart, and it would just launch a block away. This is a must have for the game as we need more creative options in Minecraft.
Allowing rotations to rails in every axis should definitely be in the game!
That is a great idea. I was just 'bout to make a post about this concept. I love to make rollercoasters, so this should definitely be apart of minecraft.
yes
we need this

I really like the signal strength being controlled by the players inventory. I think it would be great if it did both #1 and #2 detecting only player and outputting signal strength based on there inventory. You could potently have a survival arena that only allowed a specific number of items to be carried in forcing the player to choose. The only problem is how would you check to see if the player had no inventory. I guess it could be indicated with a signal strength of 1

I do like the idea of an inventory based pressure plate, to the point where I feel like that should be the focus of the post, rather than suggesting yet another pressure plate purely for the sake of having it. It could even be added as a property of the existing Polished Blackstone Pressure plate to set it apart. Diamond already has plenty going for it as it is.

you can already just use chunk loaders but i still think that mine carts should be made more useful by making them "work" in unloaded chunks. they wouldn't load the chunk but would still be able to move around.

I know this post is old, but this really needs to be in the game by now. What is the point of a minecart and chest if its only useful for contraptions that could probably just use hoppers at that short of a distance. STOP NEGLECTING MINECARTS, MAKE THEM USEFUL
Yes
Yes

I had a similar idea in that honey pistons behave like Java pistons on Bedrock and honey pistons on Java behave like Bedrock pistons to bring parity to the platforms without breaking existing mechanics and designs.
For more parity, honey pistons could replace all sticky pistons in existing java world's so that sticky and honey pistons would have the same purpose on both versions.
I think it would make a lot more sense if slime pistons have their java behavior, since slime is bouncy, and bedrock’s sticky pistons give their functionality to honey pistons, since honey is sticky.

If this it the case then we should also have a device that will convert signals. A copper connector. This would have one that would receive ansignal and the other to connect it to the different wire. So if you put redstone on one end and copper on the other it would convert that redstone signal to a copper signal. Same in reverse.
Additionally copper wires should be able to stack up vertically
It perhaps we should change the name of the device that connects redstone and to a copper outlet similar to a regular out let in that it diverts power from a source to another device.
or maybe if the hopper is leading into a cauldron

Personally I disagree, sponge consumes 300 or so water blocks. It doesn't make sense to me that this would be 1 water buckets worth.

I'd suggest water should dry while over fire and/or lava (on random tick). It'd be a really simple change which allows you to dry sponges easily
Why only on Java?
what about servers, who would it teleport?
It teleports the dispenser? That would be hilarious.
Imagine both the lag machines and the slime machines produced out of this.

This idea is interesting.  I'm more in support than I am against it, but I still don't feel one way or the other, as I feel this is kinda controversial.  Maybe like regular fire, it could burn out, unlike soul fire on soul soil and fire on netherack/bedrock.  I do think the idea of it powering things is interesting though, and would be a cool addition if this was to be a thing.
Maybe redstone ore could also burn with a red flame but it only lasts a short time like orange flames on most blocks.
I don’t see why this isn’t a thing. You can make blue dye with lapis lazuli and both are minerals with the same exact ore properties.
redstone has many purposes and no one would use this
TNT surrounded by redstone dust. Used to collect redstone blocks
So basically you're turning a little bit of redstone dust, gunpowder, and sand into a LOT of redstone.  Uh, I don't think that will happen. x3

I disagree with this idea simply because it could be replaced with the /fill command, of course, this would be usable in survival, however, it would probably be used in Minecraft servers or maps which would have cheats on anyway. It could instead destroy redstone and it’s components in a ten block radius.
just do /fill ~ ~ ~ ~10 ~10 ~10 redstone_block

One thing that would stop this from going into minecraft - the textures shown in the video are already taken up by concrete, as of 1.12.2. Also, some blocks would most likely have the same solid color. Maybe just add a block compressor workbench, that makes hard-to-break blocks? I just kinda feel like the piston setup shown is a bit too large to be useful. But otherwise, great idea!
Then you can wax it to permanently choose your delay for that specific bulb. This is genius.
This is a very good solution. I like it.
It also makes sense because in the real world when copper oxides, its conductivity also gets down, so you could connect real world and minecraft lore together.
THIS IS THE BEST IDEA EVER!
Water cannot flow out the piston unless it is extended.
Very useful for segment displays!
